intro: Celtis occidentalis var. serrulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf box-elder, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Cannabaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with finely serrated margins. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by small, spherical fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed areas. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common urban and suburban tree.
